title: Ground News - Japan's prosecutors arrest former senior vice justice minister over vote-buying allegations
text:
Summary by CGTN Former Japanese senior vice justice minister Mito Kakizawa was arrested Thursday over alleged vote-buying in a Tokyo ward mayoral election, prosecutors said. Share menu More

CGTN Lean Left Mixed Factuality Government: Chinese Communist Party Japan's prosecutors arrest former senior vice justice minister over vote-buying allegations Former Japanese senior vice justice minister Mito Kakizawa was arrested Thursday over alleged vote-buying in a Tokyo ward mayoral election, prosecutors said.
